comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content:
Hi Madeline,

Thanks for your question. These ships were floating hospitals that treated almost all of London's smallpox sufferers while they were moored there from 1884 until 1902.  The ships were isolated in a spot where the river was 800 metres wide and could only be accessed by boat.
